title: Wonders of the World
description: How well do you know the world's most famous landmarks and ancient wonders? Test your knowledge of history and geography!

questions.question: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only one of the original Seven Wonders of the Ancient World to still exist. Which country is it in?
questions.explanation: The Great Pyramid is in Giza, Egypt, and was built over 4,500 years ago.

questions.question: The Taj Mahal, a magnificent white marble tomb, was built in the 17th century. In which city is it located?
questions.explanation: The Taj Mahal is in Agra, India, and was commissioned by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan.

questions.question: Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Incan citadel located in the Andes Mountains of which country?
questions.explanation: Machu Picchu is in Peru and was likely built as an estate for the Incan emperor Pachacuti.

questions.question: The Colosseum, an ancient amphitheater that could hold over 50,000 people, is in which city?
questions.explanation: The Colosseum is the largest amphitheater ever built and is in Rome, Italy.

questions.question: The Great Wall of China stretches across northern China. It was built to protect against which nomadic group?
questions.explanation: The Great Wall was built over many centuries to protect China from raids by nomadic groups from the Eurasian Steppe, especially the Mongols.
